Comr. your talk na correct one. You see as the policy be, na gradual process wey everybody go take adapt to the system. All this kind of policy dey take time before e dey fully come to actualization. During President Buhari military regime, he changed the naira note and he did not put pressure for the naira swap not until the old note gradually was removed from existence and the new naira note was fully in circulation, Buhari never pressure any bank or organization to inact  any law and punishment for the change of note compared to this current situation. The CBN governor is bereft of ideas to run the affairs of the organization he is incharge of but I believe it will take time for Nigerians to adapt to the new policy which came to existence last year.For the fact that kaduna state governor made a statement as regards the old naira still accepted in kaduna is not a big deal although he is in the main stream government and currently likely to go against the president's directives but he is doing it for the sake of his people. People are going through lots as there no funds in circulation. Let me tell you do you think it is every purchase you do that accepts transfer? How about the market traders? Have you gone to the market to see for yourself? Now tell me will you make transfer for good worth #50 and pay for transaction charges worth #30 and above? These are the things we are talking about. How about the farmers? How about the commuters? So you want to tell me that you will do a transfer of #100 just from junction to junction with almost half of the pay as transaction charges?  People are stranded, go out and ask questions then you would know what people are really going through mate.I am not in any way criticizing your point but just the reality we are currently facing in the country. The policy is a good one but I just think the country is neither matured nor ready for that now as we can see the banks for a long time now been dealing with network issues as banks are shoting down.This is the reality of Nigeria now.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Techguysally on February 18, 2023, 10:27:43 PMWahala no they finish for this country oh, governor for kaduna tell him people say old and new naira note go still they in use say make them no fear till the Supreme Court decide other wise, talk say any person or any facility wei reject they old naira note go face they consequences.Visitors go choke for kaduna state oh.The question wey I need ask El Rufai is "Why"? What is he trying to prove? Why is going against the Supreme court. What is he afraid of? His political career? We have always known that he is a man that doesn't obey court orders. Right from the time that he was the FCT minister up until now that he is the governor of Kaduna state. Sadly, in Nigeria, the law and punishment is only for the poor and those without any political godfathers because I cannot imagine that a many who has flouted the orders of the court in Nigeria over and again would have the effrontery to go against his boss, the President and the commander of the armed forces. On the other hand, it is obvious that something is terrible wrong with our judicial system. It is obvious that their wings have been plucked off. They are in bed with politicians and so they have no power. They are no longer independent. What then is the hope of those undergraduate law students who will spend over 5 years reading for a degree in law?
